Overview

Regent's University is London's only independent, not-for-profit university, with a highly cosmopolitan and friendly community based in royal Regent's Park, in the heart of the UK's vibrant capital. Kent State students have the opportunity to study at Regent's University London for a semester term. Regent's offers a variety of classes in Fashion & Design, Business & Management, Film, Media & Performance, Liberal Studies among others.

Location

Situated in Regent's Park in London, the campus features many state-of-the-art facilities for teaching, learning, and entertainment.

Academics

Courses are taught fully in English in a variety of subject areas. The courses include the following:

Fashion & Design

Business & Management

Film, Media & Performance

Liberal Studies

and others

Living at Regent's University London

Students will live in fully-furnished rooms at the on-campus dormitory in Reid Hall. Student can choose to stay in a single, double or triple room. Each floor has three communal bathroom facilities. The hall contain a launderette located on the second floor and a reception which is staffed 24 hours.

Meal credit is offered at Regent's University where students can choose from a range of dining outlets.

Important Dates

TERM APPLICATION DEADLINE PROGRAM START DATE PROGRAM END DATE Academic Year Late April Late August Mid- June Fall Late April Late August Mid-December Spring Late October Late February Mid-June

Eligibility Requirements

Full-time, degree-seeking student at Kent State

Fashion Design and Fashion Merchandising majors only

Minimum cumulative GPA: 2.5 or higher
